metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the macos-def:accountinfo_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the macos-def:accountinfo_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the accountinfo_object is supported with the username entity equal to some value.
Test that the accountinfo_object is supported with the username entity not equal to some value.
Test that the accountinfo_object is supported with the username entity matching some regular expression.

accountinfo_test.comment: Test that the accountinfo_object is supported with the username entity equal to some value.
Test that the accountinfo_object is supported with the username entity not equal to some value.
Test that the accountinfo_object is supported with the username entity matching some regular expression.

accountinfo_object.comment: This object represents a accountinfo_object with the username equal to 'root'.
This object represents a accountinfo_object with the username not equal to 'Admin'.
This object represents a accountinfo_object with the username matching the regular expression '^ro.t$'.

accountinfo_state.comment: This accountinfo_state represents an accountinfo_item which has a username equal to 'root', a uid equal to '0', and a gid equal to '0'.
This accountinfo_state represents accountinfo_items which have a username not equal to 'root', a uid greater than or equal to '0', and a gid greater than or equal to '0'.

This accountinfo_state represents accountinfo_items which have a username that matches the regular expression '^ro.t$', a uid equal to '0', a gid equal to '0', and a login_shell that matches the regular expression '.*'.
